headline: Southern Sweet Potato Pie
description: This sweet potato pie recipe makes two tasty pies that smell amazing as they bake. Delicious at Thanksgiving or anytime of year!
name: Southern Sweet Potato Pie
recipeIngredient: 2 cups sugar, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add sweet potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 30 minutes. Drain and cool; peel and mash.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine sweet potatoes, butter, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg in a large bowl. Whisk eggs and milk together in a small bowl; blend into sweet potato mixture. Pour filling into pie shells.
Bake pies in the preheated oven for 60 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

review.reviewBody: Absolutley delish
Excellent recipe.

I used 3 small leftover baked sweet potatoes and a large can of drained sweet potatoes. I'm not crazy about nutmeg, so I only used a tiny bit. I added extra vanilla and cut the sugar to 1 cup.It took longer than an hour to cook. I had to turn the oven up to 400 degrees to get the pastry brown. The pie was very good. These are my first sweet potato pies!
It was. An easy recipe to make. Let’s see how it tastes!

Added some cinnamon in it too. I even added an extra tablespoon of vanilla. Also because this requires 2 cups of sugar I didn’t throw it all in at once I poured, stirred, poured some more, stirred some more, to gradually blend the sugar in better. Love the results came out amazing!

This recipe is so amazingly easy!!! The only change I made is like everyone else I added a little cinnamon to the mixture. But I also changed the sugar amount. I have a lot of diabetics in my family so I do one cup of sugar and half cup of brown sugar. It’s still super delicious!!!
I made this using the exact same ingredients but with a different amount of measurements for a serving size of 6 pies. It looks good and taste great!
I made this for the first time on thanksgiving. I followed the exact recipe. Everyone loved it !!!!!!! I even had a request to make another. Will be using this from now on. Thank you
As is. No alterations.
YES I used brown and white sugars. Half brown half white. And the compliments have wonderful!!
Instead of evaporated milk I had used eggnog.
Easy quick prep. Pretty fool proof and quite tasty. Reccomend real sweet cream butter not spread or margarine.
Marvelous! Love it!
No additional changes made and I will surely make it again
I cook to taste. I added extra brown sugar and real butter. I also used GRAHAM CRACKER CRUST
Seems watery but looks fantastic! Also the time allotted for sweet potatoes did seem to undercook them
I loved the recipe. I added sugar, (as suggested as an option). I will make this again. Thank you!
The pies came out So good
I love this recipe,I made it for my family and it turned out great ?? very easy to follow instructions and delicious recipe!
No changes will make again
Création recipe Washington tout make
Every year my family enjoys this dessert during the holidays

I use to like sweet potato pie. This rescript made me LOVE this pie. I have to make it sometimes too frequent. I asked my friend what to you want me to bring? My soup? My cake? she said: "The Sweet Potato Pie." I've had a perso tell me: "This is better than Patti's sweet potato pie." I love her (Patti) . I just add lemon (1/2) squeezed, I double the flavoring an add 1/4 teaspoon of ginger. It taste like Christmas! I know I wasn't suppose to change this but you tweak it an it may help someone and this is how I started it a great recipe!
I used the recipe that’s on here and my family enjoyed it!!!! Thanks
I used only a half cup of white sugar and one and a half cup of brown sugar... I also add cinnamon to the mixture. It turned out great!!!

I would make again. 

But I recall my Grandma’s pies being darker. Does anyone have a suggestion to make the filling darker? I already increased the nutmeg to 1 teaspoon and added a pinch of cinnamon.
I will keep this recipe! I liked it, and I used it on the holiday. Every one wanted more than one serving.

Delicious! I may try baking the sweet potatoes next time I make this. I would add more spices to it as well but overall a very delicious pie and came out better than I thought considering it was my first time ever making a sweet potato pie!
Such an easy recipe & so very good, we couldn’t stop eating it!!!!
I made this today. I cut that sugar way down to one packed cup of brown sugar. It was more than sweet enough. Added cloves. I also blended in my Vitamix. Very smooth. Will make again.

Enjoyed this recipe after I made some minor alterations. First 3 sweet potatoes equals about 4 cups. For those who need to measure. I also increased my nutmeg to 3/4 teaspoon to add additional flavor. With those minor adjustments it made it perfect for my family.
I made these Sweet Potato Pies for Thanksgiving. Everyone loved them! Just like the pies my mother used to make. Absolutely fabulous!
Super easy and perfect. I make it as is (adding nutmeg to my taste) and the ENTIRE family requests a pie every Thanksgiving (some requesting months in advance). Love love love!
made the pies. delicious
I add a Tsp of lemon extract (this brings out the favor of the potato) and I had a small bottle of Jack Daniels to the batter. Don't worry the alcohol cooks out and you are left an amazing pie.
The best pie ever! My go to!
I love the recipe. It was even better when I added cinnamon.
This recipe is delicious! I only added a 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon & OMG!! You won't be disappointed. Happy baking!

I made this pie 3 Thanksgiving ago and I been hooked since. I'll sometimes add 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. I also in the past have reduced the white sugar to 2 cups instead of 2 1/2 cups. Either way, both recipes modified or not taste delicious! Don't worry on doubling the recipe. This fills 3 pie shells (depending how large sweet potatoes you buy).
Great recipe, as many others I made some small adjustments, 2 large potatoes, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon with sugar and 1/3 light brown sugar. Pretty Close to Grandmas pie!??
Love this recipe! I use pumpkin pie spice, yum!

This pie is truly delicious. I also added the cinnamon just because we love it.
The pie was a huge hit and I'm glad I made it :)
I made this last year and this year. Best recipe !!!!!!!
I made this last year and this year. Best recipe !!!!!!!
Good recipe. I would add some light brown sugar about 1/4 cup; it gives it a more "soulful" taste. All in all, everything was good!
Now THAT'S Sweet Potato Pie! I use this guide 2-3 years ago... and it's become a part of Thanksgiving at my table since.

This is my go to every year. I get more compliment and that makes me very happy. I buy the deep dish pie shells and use 6 large potatoes, as I like a full pie. I add 1/2 t. of cinnamon and the taste never disappoints.
I use this recipe and turn it into a gluten free sweet potato pie and it is awesome. I always have left over sweet potato mixture and turn it into a souffle. This is a great and simple recipe
My family loved this pie! Made 3 pies last night and there is only one left. Following this recipe you can't go wrong!!

Turned out great. Much creamier and not so dry as the previous recipe I tried. I did bake my potatoes and then peeled... I did add a little cinnamon and I added a few more potatoes as the ones I used were not large enough to get the pie filled adequately. My only advice would be to use BIG potatoes or use 2 for 1 if you don't have any large ones.

Wonderful recipe, I am from the south and was very nervous about fixing this particular pie since my mom has done it for years! It was a big hit and everyone loved it. I love this website, it has changed my attitude towards cooking. If you havent joined you are missing out!
This was a delicious pie but it does not need all that sugar. Sweet potatos are already sweet. I cut the sugar down to 1/2 cup and it was plenty sweet.

I made this for my first Christmas (just passed) with my new in-laws. My husband had never had sweet potato pie and was hesitant to try it, but once he did he loved it. My new mother and father-in-law each had a piece and they really loved it! I like the fact that it's not as heavy as a pumpkin pie; my mother-in-law had never had it either and said it had a "good flavour". It does make two really full pies and I had filling left over. I saved it to make some tarts with, so there's no waste. (BTW: My dogs LOVE sweet potatos and one was trying to eat the peels as I made these pies! So, I boiled two extra potatos and mashed them with their skins on to feed to the dogs. I give them a spoonful in their kibble. They just inhale it! Another way I've cooked sweet potatos for them is to cut them up and boil them in chicken broth with cut up cabbage. They just go crazy for it!)
I have been making this recipe for several years. I reduced the sugar to one cup and I substituted the nutmeg for cinnamon. My pie is always a hit.
BEST ONE YET!!!!
The pie baked well it firmed up when I cut into the pie it didn't run. I added cinnamon 1/2 tsp. The next time I make this pie maybe I use less milk. I served the pie warm with Vanilla Ice cream.
I'm now known as the best pie maker thanks to this recipe.

This was my first time making a sweet potatoe pie since my mom has been gone. I only made one in the year of 2008 for Thanksgiving and in that same year right before Christmas my mom passed away. So for me trying out this recipe for the first time, I got so many good ratings. My co-workers want me to bake one for them. This was truly a quick and easy recipe.. "THE PIE WAS SOOOO GOOD"

I made three pies and a custard by doubling the recipe and cooking the forth in a glass dish for my gluten free friends. My boss said it was the most delicious pie he had ever eaten and my friend said she'd kill me if I didn't give her the recipe.

My rating is a four star because of the evaporated milk. I could taste it with/over the sweet potatoes. It added a rich/caramelly touch which I thought was really nice but detracted from the sweet potatoes. I would have given it three stars, as a good recipe, but the rave reviews pushed it up.

For alterations, I did half white, half brown sugar and topped one with marshmallow. I also used my own spice blend and upped the spices, as milk products mute the flavour of pumpkin pie spice. I also used orange sweet potatoes, but I'm keen to try it with purple, as I have had good success with purple candied yams.

I wasn't expecting that this being my first time making a sweet potato pie that it was going to taste so good. I would probably cut the sugar down by 1/2 cup but this recipe is a keeper. Tastes like memories.
great, i love it!

I LOVED IT!!! First time making sweet potato pie. I couldn't stop eating the batter it was sooooo good. 

I may have accidently added more vanilla extract than what was called. I also read from another review to add ground cinnamon and extra milk so i did that to. Im soooo excited about this dish and can't wait to share it with friends and family. I defiantly recommend this recipe.
I love this recipe but did cut sugar down t 1 1/2 cups that madeit perfect
Simple and easy! Loved it!
I used this recipe for thanksgiving and the pies turned out GREAT! I was out of nutmeg so I used all spice. Wonderful recipe.
My family love this pie. As you can see from my pics they turn out beautiful and delicious.
This is a great recipe I have cooked it for thanksgiving two years in a row. Both times my family ate every crumb.
Great!
A little sweet,will cut sugar amount next time.I added ground cloves and ginger to this recipe
Easy to make and delicious. I did add a little cinnamon everything else I did exactly as stated and it was super yummy.
i love this recipe
Delicious recipe! I don't know if I used the right size pie crust, but i ended up making 4 pies. Thank goodness I had extra pie shells in my freezer. But very easy and the family loves it!
I come back to this recipe every year for Thanksgiving. I've even told people how to look it up directly by name. I do tend to go with a graham cracker crust, but that is the only thing I change
Great and easy to make... I recommend using canned sweet potatoes (15oz); instead of peeling and boiling your own.

I loved this sweet potatoe pie however I did some things a little different I used 6 large sweet potatoe and baked 45 min cooled them and pealed and mashed I used 1 1/2 c of Splenda in place of white sugar I used 1/2 c of regular brown sugar 1/4 tsp cinnamon as well as nutmeg I used the rest of the original recipe. this was a great hit it was not real sweet I also topped with coolwhip I give it 5 STAR this is great if you have to watch you sugar intake. This amount made 2 pies
Love it! My brother says it's the best he's ever had! First time I used the amount of sugar as directed & thought it was too sweet, so I reduced the sugar by 1/2 cup &, tada! Perfect!
This was easy to prepare and turned out beautifully! My Southern husband didn't know a Yankee like me could fix one this good and in 2 days, has eaten the whole pie!
I made this for my husbands birthday and he said it was the best one he had ever had.
I REALLY wish people would give units of measure! Seriously folks - last I checked sweet potatoes were not manufactured to a specific size or weight. Ah, the glory of mother nature!
I had never made a sweet potato pie before. This was a hit at my Thanksgiving Dinner. It was delicious. I will make this again.

This was good but I agree that saying three sweet potatoes wasn't an acurate measurement because they vary in size; I also used canned sweet potatoes so it was harder to figure out. I'd say I used about 2 cups.

Had never made sweet potato pie before this recipe.Made it for pot luck at work before thanksgiving and they were a hit!!Now I have people that are requesting that I make them... Thanks for making me look good!!

Great pie, but I revised the recipe a little. After reading the other reviews I reduced the white sugar to 1 3/4 cups and added 1/4 cup of brown sugar. I used 2 eggs instead of 4 and used condensed milk instead of evaporated. I added cinnamon to taste and also added a splash of lemon flavor. Delicious!
This was my first time baking a pie and it was GREAT! I am not big on pies but I could not resist this one. My son loves sweet potatoe pie and said that this pie was "fire".

Absolutely awesome! Even some who don't normally like sweet potato pie like this recipe. Instead of 2 1/2 cups of white sugar, I used 2 cups of white sugar and 1/2 cup of brown sugar. I also add 1 tsp. of cinammon. I bake for 40 minutes at 350, then turn the oven down to 300, cover the crust with aluminum foil and continue for another 30 minutes. This prevents the crust from getting too dark. I use ready-made graham cracker crust.
My hubby and kids gobbled this pie up.....added cinnamon....but besides that made exactly....I had a piece and must say it was yummy.....
This recipe is awesome! This was my first time making a pie and it turned out great.
It was good, a little too sweet though. But over all good.
Can anyone give a tip as to how many cups of sweet potatos to use? Saying 3 is not very descriptive
This was great. just what i was looking for. baked at stated temp for 35min and finished out at 325. Will be my go to recipe from now on. Loved it.

Being from GA I had never had a pumpkin pie! It was always Sweet Potato that my family made for the holidays. I had been wanting one for some time now. My husband's family is from KY - Pumpkin was it and I never got SP. So I decided it was time to try to make one like I had as a child. Store bought have way too much spice and just didn't do it for me. This pie was very close to what I remember. Recipe calls for 3 sweet potatoes. Sweet potatoes come in all sizes and shapes. I wish that it had stated how many cups. I ended up with 4 cups of potatoes. I only used 2 cup of sugar and that was plenty, any more and I think it would have been too sweet, as some people have said in their review. I did not have nutmeg, so on one pie I sprinkled a little cinnamon. Both were good with and without it. Other than a little less sugar the only thing that I would change would be to add maybe 1 teaspoon of salt to the mixture, other than that it is a good recipe that I am keeping. Oh, and I started checking it at 45 min.s so I did not burn it. The pies were ready at 50 min.s but ovens cook differently. I start checking though at 45 min.s.
I made a half recipe and it tasted great. I have had better though. I dont approve of all this sugar and I think I should have added another egg.

This was my first sweet potato pie and we all loved it! Very quick and easy and delicious. I followed other's advice and reduced the sugar. I used about 1 3/4 cup instead of 2 1/2. It was plenty sweet - can't imagine it sweeter. Also added cinnamon.

OK, please use this recipe. I always follow people suggestions. So I only used 3 eggs and 2 cups of sugar. It still is a little so sweet so next time I will use 1 1/2 cups of sugar. I also added cinnamon. GREAT! I WILL use this for Thanksgiving!
We all loved this pie. The second one I gave to my father in law and wanted to know when he was getting another one.
First pie ever, turned out great.
followed the recipe, except cut the sugar in half as suggested by others. I also did not use a crust ...it was wonderful and both my young kids liked it as well
followed the recipe, except cut the sugar in half as suggested by others. I also did not use a crust ...it was wonderful and both my young kids liked it as well
I followed the instructions for this and my pie came out perfectly!!!! Just like mom used to make.
